New Records: The Cavaliers extended their winning streak to 10, with all 10 victories being by double digits, a franchise record.
Key Match Events: Cleveland began the second quarter with a 24-6 run, fueled by its two big men, to build a commanding 53-29 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Isaac Okoro, who has been sidelined since Dec. 20 with a right shoulder sprain, was cleared to practice with no restrictions.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers won for the 18th time in 19 home games and are 31-4 overall.
Miscellaneous Highlights: LaMelo Ball and Brandon Miller paced Charlotte with 24 points apiece, while Nick Smith Jr. had 18 off the bench.
Others: Cleveland has not lost since Dec. 8 at Miami, and its lone home defeat was Nov. 27 against Atlanta.
